page.title: 18RELIGION
page.content: The church was built in l936 to replace the one destroyed during the l939/45 war. The vicarage is next door to the church. There have been several changes in the incumbent in the last few years, but now the vicar is a family man. The church is a focal centre, and if the services are not regularly attended, the bazaars and other social events draw people together, and gives the village a symbol of unity. During the summer months the church opens its doors to Roman Catholic Services. The sunday school is well attended, and other events for the younger members of the community are gaining considerable interest. The influence is subtle but it is a small but beautiful church which adds character to the village.
